name: Will-o'-Wisp
lore: A will-o'-wisp is a malevolent, incorporeal spirit that haunts swamps, bogs, and other treacherous terrain. It appears as a flickering, ghostly light—sometimes pale blue, sometimes sickly green—and uses its glow to lure unwary travelers into deadly hazards. The wisp feeds on the despair and life force of dying creatures, savoring the moment a victim succumbs.

understood: The languages it knew in life

traits.name: Ephemeral
traits.description: The wisp can't wear or carry anything.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.description: The wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Variable Illumination
traits.description: The wisp sheds Bright Light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius, or it sheds no light.

actions.name: Shock
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach 5 ft. Hit: 9 (2d8) Lightning damage.

actions.name: Invisibility
actions.description: The wisp and its light magically become Invisible until the wisp attacks or uses Consume Life, or until its Concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

bonusActions.name: Consume Life
bonusActions.description: The wisp targets one creature within 5 feet of it that has 0 Hit Points and is still alive. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or die. If the target dies, the wisp regains 10 (3d6) Hit Points.

savingThrow.targets: one creature within 5 feet that has 0 Hit Points and is still alive

onFailure.effects: The target dies. The wisp regains 10 (3d6) Hit Points.
